member.name: T:KusDepot.Cryptography.GeneralDataEnvelope
member.summary: Data protection with RSA and AES-GCM.

item.description: Header (variable length):
[0] : Version (1 byte)
[1] : Flags (1 byte)
[2..3] : RsaWrappedLen (UInt16)
[4..(4+R-1)] : RSA wrapped AES key + base nonce seed (R bytes)
[4+R] : chunksizepower (1 byte)
[opt] : OriginalLength (UInt64, 8 bytes) if Flag_HasOriginalLength
[opt] : AadHash (64 bytes) if Flag_HasAadHash
(Header length : see ComputeHeaderLength
Chunk (repeated):
[0..3] : Plaintext length (UInt32)
[4..7] : Ciphertext length (UInt32)
[8..(8+C-1)] : Ciphertext (C bytes)
[8+C] : TagSize (1 byte, always 16)
[8+C+1..8+C+16] : GCM Tag (16 bytes)
Footer (if not using original length):
[0] : FooterMarker (0xF0)
[1..4] : ChunkCount (UInt32)
Nonce for each chunk is derived via HMAC-SHA512(aeskey, basenonceseed || chunkindex) and truncated to 12 bytes.
Per-chunk AAD is SHA512 hash of header fields + chunk index + lengths + optional fields.
If Flag_HasOriginalLength is set, no footer is present; otherwise, footer marks end and chunk count.
All multi-byte integers are big endian.
Envelope = header + chunks + (optional footer)

member.name: M:KusDepot.Cryptography.GeneralDataEnvelope.EncryptSpan(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Byte},System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2,System.Int32@,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Boolean)
member.param: Buffer to write the envelope to.
The number of bytes written to the output span.
If true, a SHA512 hash of aad is stored in the header.

remarks.para: This method is optimized for small, in-memory payloads and processes the input as a single chunk.

item.description: It always includes the original plaintext length in the header.
VersionByte: Envelope version.
Flags: Bitfield indicating presence of optional fields (OriginalLength, AadHash).
RsaWrappedLen: Length of RSA-wrapped AES key + base nonce seed.
ChunkSizePower: Power-of-two chunk size (e.g., 20 for 1MB chunks).
HasOriginalLength: True if the original plaintext length is included in the header.
HasAadHash: True if a SHA512 hash of user-supplied AAD is included in the header.
OriginalLength: The original plaintext length (if present).
AadHash: SHA512 hash of AAD (if present).
HeaderTotalLength: Total length of the parsed header in bytes.
The header is authenticated via per-chunk AAD and is required for correct parsing and decryption.
ChunkCount: The total number of chunks in the envelope.
The footer is present only if the original length is not included in the header.
The footer marker (0xF0) is used to signal the end of the envelope and prevent truncation attacks.
ChunkCount is used to verify integrity and completeness of the envelope.

member.summary: Reads and processes the envelope header from a span.

When this method returns, contains the parsed header information.

When this method returns, contains the decrypted AES key.

member.remarks:
This method performs the following steps:
Parses the header fields from the input span.
Decrypts the RSA-wrapped key material to obtain the AES key and nonce seed.
Validates the AAD hash if it is present in the header.
Outputs a slice of the input span representing the body of the envelope.

member.name: M:KusDepot.Cryptography.GeneralDataEnvelope.DecryptStream(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.param: AAD value that must exactly match the AAD used at encryption.
member.returns: True if decryption and authentication succeed; false otherwise.

item.description: Read first 4 bytes (version, flags, rsaLen); validate version and flag bits.
Read rest of header (variable) and parse optional OriginalLength / AadHash.
RSA-OAEP decrypt wrapped material -> AES key + base nonce seed.
If AadHash present: compute SHA512(aad) and perform fixed-time equality check.
OriginalLength mode: read length blocks until EOF; must match declared OriginalLength exactly.
Footer mode: read length blocks until FooterMarker encountered, then validate chunk count and absence of trailing bytes.
For each chunk:
a. Read plainLen, cipherLen, ciphertext, tagLen, tag.
b. Reject if plainLen != cipherLen or sizes exceed chunk size bound.
c. Derive nonce via HMACSHA512(aesKey, baseNonceSeed || chunkindex) -> first 12 bytes.
d. Build per-chunk descriptor and SHA512 hash -> perChunkAad.
e. AES-GCM decrypt and authenticate; on failure terminate and return false.
Ordering enforced via chunkindex in AAD.
Tampering with header, lengths, ciphertext, tags, or footer triggers authentication or structural failure.
Replay or reordering of chunks invalid unless attacker can forge GCM tag.
Structural: truncated header, invalid lengths, unexpected EOF, footer mismatch.
Cryptographic: RSA failure, GCM authentication failure, HMAC/AAD build errors.
Policy: Version mismatch, unsupported flags, chunk size overflow.

member.param: AAD value that must exactly match the AAD used at encryption.
member.returns: True if decryption and authentication succeed; false otherwise.

member.name: M:KusDepot.Cryptography.GeneralDataEnvelope.EncryptStream(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.param: If true, a SHA512 hash of aad is stored in the header and bound into per-chunk AAD.
If true, original total plaintext length is written in header and footer is omitted.
Base-2 exponent determining chunk size. Bounds: 12..26.

item.description: Validate arguments (stream capabilities, chunksizepower bounds, optional fields consistency).
Optionally determine original length (requires seekable input) when includeoriginallength = true.
Generate random AES-256 key and 16-byte base nonce seed; concatenate and RSA-OAEP(SHA-512) encrypt them.
Emit header: version | flags | rsawrappedlen | wrappedbytes | chunksizepower | [originallength?] | [aadhash?].
For each read chunk (up to chunkSize):
a. Derive per-chunk nonce = first 12 bytes of HMACSHA512(aeskey, basenonceseed || chunkindex).
b. Build per-chunk AAD descriptor (Version, Flags, ChunkIndex, PlainLength, [OriginalLength], [AadHash]) and hash with SHA512 -> perChunkAad.
c. Encrypt with AES-GCM(nonce, plaintextChunk, perChunkAad) -> ciphertextChunk, tag.
d. Write: UInt32 plainLen | UInt32 cipherLen | ciphertext | Byte tagLen (16) | tag.
If includeoriginallength = false write footer marker (0xF0) and UInt32 chunkCount.
Confidentiality: AES-256-GCM with unique nonce per chunk derived from HMAC prevents reuse across indices.
Integrity and Authenticity: GCM tag covers ciphertext and per-chunk AAD which commits to ordering, lengths, version, flags, optional global fields.
Ordering: Chunk index hashed into per-chunk AAD prevents silent reordering or duplication.
Length / Truncation: Original length or footer chunk count detects premature truncation or over-extension.
AAD Binding: If includeaadhash = true, user-supplied context is bound globally.

member.name: T:KusDepot.AccessKeySecret
member.summary: Encrypts and verifies access key tokens with a dynamic permission bitmap protected by RSA + AES-GCM.

item.description: [0] : Version (1 byte)
[1..32] : Nonce (32 bytes random entropy)
[33..48] : IssuerToolId (16 raw Guid bytes)
[49..64] : AccessManagerId (16 raw Guid bytes)
[65..72] : IssuedAtUnix (Int64, big-endian, seconds since Unix epoch)
[73..80] : NotAfterUnix (Int64, big-endian, 0 = no expiry)
[81..82] : SubjectLengthSize (UInt16, big-endian) = S
[83..(83+S-1)] : SubjectBytes (UTF-16LE serialized subject string)
[83+S..83+S+1] : PermissionBlockCount (UInt16, big-endian) = B
[83+S+2..(83+S+2+(B*16)-1)] : PermissionBitmap (B * 16 bytes, variable size)
[83+S+2+(B*16)+16..end] : AccessKeyToken (64 bytes SHA-512 hash over Version..Salt)
FixedPrefix = VersionSize + NonceSize + GuidSize + GuidSize + TimeStampSize + TimeStampSize + SubjectLengthSize = 83 bytes
PlaintextLength = FixedPrefix + S + PermissionBlockCountSize + (B * BytesPerBlock) + SaltSize + TokenHashSize
AAD = Version (1 byte) | IssuerToolId (16 bytes) | AccessManagerId (16 bytes)
Up to 128 blocks * 128 bits = 16384 operation indices (0..16383).
Block = index / 128, Bit = index % 128.
Each block serialized big-endian; internal bit numbering uses LSB = bit 0 for shift operations.
AccessKeyToken = SHA-512(plaintext[0..SaltEnd]).
Confidentiality: AES-256-GCM.
Integrity and Authenticity: GCM tag over ciphertext + AAD plus internal SHA-512 hash.
Token Identity / Revocation Handle: 64-byte AccessKeyToken.
Certificate null or issuer Guid empty.
Subject length exceeds UInt16 maximum.
Operation index out of range (<0 or 16384) during creation.
Decryption failure (tag mismatch, RSA unwrap failure, structural corruption).
Version mismatch (plaintext[0] != supported version).
Length / bounds inconsistency (computed lengths exceed buffer).
Issuer mismatch (decrypted IssuerToolId != expected).
Hash mismatch (recomputed SHA-512 != stored AccessKeyToken).
Expired (current time > NotAfterUnix when NotAfterUnix != 0).

member.name: M:KusDepot.AccessKeySecret.TryCreate(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2,System.Guid,System.Guid,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Byte[]@,KusDepot.AccessKeyToken@)
member.param: X509 certificate containing public/private key pair.
Guid identifying the issuing tool instance.
Subject string (identity namespace) serialized as UTF-16LE.
Sequence of operation indices to authorize (0..16383).
Optional lifetime for expiry; if null or <= 0 then token does not expire (NotAfterUnix = 0).
Output: encrypted token bytes on success.

item.description: Validate inputs: certificate non-null, toolid not empty, subject length UInt16.MaxValue.
Calculate the minimum number of permission blocks required and set bits for each operation index; reject any out-of-range index.
Generate Nonce and Salt via a CSPRNG.
Serialize fields in order, using big-endian for multi-byte integers.
Compute SHA-512 hash over Version..Salt and append as token.
Encrypt whole plaintext with (AES-GCM + RSA key wrap) using AAD = Version|toolid|accessmanagerid.

member.name: M:KusDepot.AccessKeySecret.GetEncryptionOverhead(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.returns: The approximate required overhead in bytes.

member.summary: Decrypts, validates, and extracts token metadata.
member.param: Certificate containing RSA private key for decryption.
Tool Issuer ID expected for this token.
AccessManager ID expected for this token.
Output: copy of the variable-length permission bitmap.
Output: Expiration time if present; null if not set.
member.returns: True if decrypted and validated successfully; false otherwise.

item.description: Attempt decryption with AAD = Version|toolid|accessmanagerid.
Validate structure (minimum lengths, subject and permission bounds).
Confirm Version and toolid.
Recompute SHA-512 and constant-time compare with stored AccessKeyToken.
Expose permission bitmap and expiration; flag expiration status.

item.description: A subject string (tool, command, or anonymous GUID namespace).
An 8192-bit permission bitmap (UInt128 * 64).
A 32-byte AccessKeyToken used for membership revocation.
Token decrypted and parsed (subject, bitmap, AccessKeyToken, expiry) with issuer binding (AAD = Version|ToolId).
Permission bit tested; membership verified against AccessKeys.
Expired or unknown operations fail.

member.name: T:KusDepot.ProtectedOperation
member.summary: Defines numeric operation indices used for permission bitmap.

remarks.para: The constants in this class form the mapping between protected operation names and their integer indices in the permission bitmap issued inside access tokens.

item.description: Append-only: never reorder or reuse an index value once published.
Indices are consumed by the access token issuer when constructing the permission bitmap.
Authorization checks resolve a caller member name to one of these index values (see ).

member.name: T:KusDepot.ProtectedOperationSets
member.summary: Predefined protected operation index sets for key issuance profiles.

remarks.para: These static arrays define the operation indices embedded into access tokens for different key categories (Client, Service, Command, Host, MyHost, Executive).

item.description: Values reference constants in .

member.name: T:KusDepot.ProtectedOperationResolver
member.summary: Resolves operation names to protected operation indices.

remarks.para: This resolver maps the string name of a protected method to the corresponding integer constant defined in .

item.description: Caller invokes a secured method with an AccessKey.
The method's access check supplies its own name implicitly.
produces the integer index or -1.
Bit test performed against the permission bitmap inside the decrypted token.

member.name: M:KusDepot.ProtectedOperationResolver.ResolveIndex(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Map an operation name to its protected operation index.

item.description: A return value of -1 MUST be treated as an authorization failure.

member.name: T:KusDepot.Tool
member.remarks: The Tool is a foundation for business workflows. It stores DataItems and hosts Services and Commands, which define specialized compartmentalized functionality. member.name: M:KusDepot.Utility.GenerateDeterministicHashCode(System.Object)
member.summary: Generate a deterministic content-based hash code for an object.
member.returns: A deterministic hash code based on the object's content.

remarks.para: This method produces a deterministic hash code for objects by serializing the object's structure and content into a byte representation and hashing it with SHA512.
Supports primitives, strings, arrays, lists, sets, dictionaries, DateTime, Guid, Version, Uri, BigInteger, Half, IntPtr, and custom objects with public properties.
Returns a fixed value for null input. For objects that cause a stack overflow, returns a hash of the type name.
